snippet: States often exceeded federal guidelines during the outbreak, sometimes with haphazard consequences, according to a new report.
abstract: Debate continues over government's actions in imposing quarantines upon American citizens during Ebola outbreak, even as epidemic and attendant panic has largely subsided; state governments in several cases exceeded CDC recommendations to monitor those who may have come in contact with Ebola, raising questions over legality of their actions; some of those confined describe lost wages, stress and lack of access to services and support.
lead_paragraph: States often exceeded federal guidelines during the outbreak, sometimes with haphazard consequences, according to a new report.

headline.main: Ebola Crisis Passes, but Questions on Quarantines Persist
headline.print_headline: Debate on Quarantine Persists as Ebola Outbreak Subsides

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
